string.text: Leather trench coat
A simple leather trench coat, often worn by beginning stalkers. It doesn't provide protection from bullets or anomalies, but it is comfortable to wear. There are no built-in containers for artifacts.
Wind of Freedom bodysuit

This lightweight stalker bodysuit is made by Freedom craftsmen. The suit's fabric is treated with Horizon, a special solution developed by the faction by trial and error to increase resistance to anomalies. Like the Sunrise suit, the Wind of Freedom comes with built-in body armor and artifact containers.
Sunrise bodysuit

This DIY stalker bodysuit is a combination of a bodysuit of twin-layered rubberized cloth with Plexiglas lining and built-in body armor. Despite the fact that the body armor is incapable of protecting the wearer from even pistol bullets, the suit enjoys great popularity due to its low cost and modification potential. Comes with built-in artifact containers.
SEVA bodysuit

This suit, produced by one of Kiev's Defense Research Institutes, is a great alternative to homemade stalker suits. While its built-in body armor can only stop a pistol round, the anomaly and radiation protection system is second to none. Fully upgradeable and boasting two built-in artifact containers, this bodysuit is the equipment of choice for many experienced stalkers.
SSP-99 Ecologist bodysuit

The SCP-99 Ecologist bodysuit was made to protect the wearer in the harsh conditions of the Zone and it has a built-in air-filtration and air-conditioning system to protect the wearer from chemical gases. It is used by expeditions of scientists and the stalkers cooperating with them. Despite not being designed for combat operations, but rather laboratory research it still comes with five artifact containers and is equipped with a second-generation night vision device.
PS5-M Universal Protection

This modern version of the Duty bodysuit is better suited for stalker recruits who are used to lightweight suits. Unlike the PSZ series, this suit provides good protection against anomalies while also being capable of stopping a pistol bullet. The suit cannot be modified with an artifact container, but may be upgraded with a combat support system instead.
CS-2 body armor

The reinforced vest and built-in gas mask provide good protection from bullets and anomalies, in comparison with earlier models. However it doesn't provide sufficient protection for serious expeditions towards the center of the Zone. It comes with built-in artifact containers.
CS-3a body armor

Once used as standard by Clear Sky assault squads, after the faction’s elimination this armor serves as a reminder that even an excellent protective bodysuit cannot guarantee you safety this side of the perimeter. The armor is capable of stopping a pistol bullet, while the wearer is also well protected from anomalies. Comes with a built-in artifact container.
 
%c[255,255,255,255]Is used with: %c[default]Sphere T1I helmet
Freedom Guard bodysuit

This stalker bodysuit with reinforced body armor made by Freedom craftsmen represents a good compromise between combat and anomaly protection. The built-in body armor comprises armor plating and ten Kevlar layers, capable of stopping a pistol bullet. The suit uses the relatively expensive Sovereign compound for anomaly protection. Comes with an artifact container.
Berill-5M armored suit

This item comprises military PS5 series body armor with beryllium sputter modified for use in the Zone. Designed for assault operations in highly radioactive areas, it is ineffective in areas of high anomalous activity. The suit makes its way to stalkers through the military, who exchange it for loot. Does not come with an artifact container.
 
%c[255,255,255,255]Is used with: %c[default]Sphere M12 helmet
Berill-5M1 armored suit

This item comprises military PS5 series body armor with beryllium sputter modified for use in the Zone. Designed for assault operations in highly radioactive areas, it is ineffective in areas of high anomalous activity. The suit makes its way to stalkers through the military, who exchange it for loot. Does not come with an artifact container.
(Commander)
 
%c[255,255,255,255]Is used with: %c[default]Sphere M12 helmet
Bulat armored suit

This modern military armored suit is designed for assault operations in anomalous areas. Comprises a PSZ-12p heavy military armored suit, built-in compensation suit, and an anomalous protection bodysuit. The armor provides excellent protection against bullet and fragmentation damage, without greatly reducing the wearer's mobility. Does not come with an artifact container.
 
%c[255,255,255,255]Is used with: %c[default]Sphere M12 helmet
PSZ-9d Duty Armor

This early model of the Duty bodysuit is the Spetsnaz PSZ-9 body armor modified for the Zone. The suit is capable of stopping a rifle bullet, however, this level of protection comes at the cost of its weight, bulkiness and virtually non-existent anomaly protection. The suit cannot be modified with an artifact container, but may be upgraded with a combat support system.
 
%c[255,255,255,255]Is used with: %c[default]Sphere D helmet
Exoskeleton

An experimental sample of a military exoskeleton. Was never mass-produced due to extraordinary cost and some design flaws. Despite this, it is in demand due to its ability to take on the weight of all carried equipment, and therefore small batches are made in underground facilities outside Ukraine. Comes with a built-in artifact container.
Gas mask

A regular plastic and rubber gas mask, used for filtering air for radioactive particles and poisonous substances. Widely used by rookies and veterans of all factions due to its universal functionality. Does not provide any physical protection.
Screen helmet

A light helmet with an airtight visor intended for protection from anomalies. Judging by the design, the helmet is made by the same Defense Research Institutes as the SEVA bodysuit. Its intended use may very well be in combination with military suits for operations in highly anomalous areas.
Steel helmet

A desperately outdated steel army helmet without any additions. Provides no protection against anomalies or radiation, but can deflect bullets. This helmet was never particularly popular in the Zone, except for use in brief armed conflicts between factions.
Sphere T1I helmet

A Western model of a tactical helmet that lacks camouflage. It is not known how it made its way into the Zone. The helmet is designed to provide a squad leader with strategic superiority over the enemy via its many scanners and satellite communications devices, which have not been installed in this particular helmet. Comes with multi-layered Kevlar protection and armored elements to protect electronic components. Includes a respirator and a first generation night vision device.
Sphere M12 helmet

An aluminum/titanium helmet with a cloth exterior that comes with pockets for additional steel armor pieces and an armor face mask. Sphere M12 is normally used as part of a combination that includes PSZ series Spetsnaz body armor. Quite popular in the Zone thanks to its respirator and built-in first generation night vision device, as well as providing the maximum head protection possible. Comes with electronics slots.
SEVA bodysuit

This bodysuit, intended for conducting research in the Zone, combines a closed-cycle respiratory module and an external isolation coating, resulting in excellent protection from anomalies. Due to poor protection from physical impact, the suit is not a good defense against bullet and fragmentation damage. Comes with a built-in artifact transportation container.
Bulat armored suit

A military armored suit made for assault operations. Provides outstanding protection against full metal jacket rounds and fragmentation damage without reducing the wearer's mobility. Vulnerable to armor-piercing rounds.
Exoskeleton
This exoskeleton provides outstanding protection against bullet and fragmentation damage at the cost of mobility. Vulnerable to armor-piercing rounds.
Leather Jacket

The traditional bandit outfit is a leather jacket with woven in armor segments. It provides some protection against the elements, however extremely insufficient in the harsh conditions of the Zone. Equipped with a built-in container for artifacts.
Brown bandit raincoat

Bandit leather raincoat with armor segments woven into it. Provides a little more protection for the owner against the elements then a jacket. It is however still insufficient against the harsh environment of the Zone. It is equipped with a built-in container for artifacts.
Black bandit raincoat

Bandit leather raincoat with armor segments woven into it. Provides a little more protection for the owner against the elements and firearms then a jacket. It is however still insufficient against the harsh environment of the Zone. It is equipped with a built-in container for artifacts.
Sunset bodysuit
A handcrafted modification of a stalker suit. It's a simple body suit with added protection against anomalies. Comes with a built-in container for artifacts.
Mercenary bodysuit
A type of stalker suit. It includes lightweight body armor with additional protection against anomalies. There is a built-in container for artifacts.
Mercenary Exoskeleton
Foreign made Exoskeleton. This model is the assault version with increased bullet and explosion resistance, but only provides standard protection against anomalies.
Soldier uniform

A standard set of soldier equipment - a light army body armor. It is effective against light firearms and shrapnel, however ineffective against anomalies and other hazards. Does not come with an artifact container.
PSZ-9Md Universal Protection

A wonderful protective suit for the Zone. Stalkers appreciate it because it combines excellent anomaly-proof and bullet-proof qualities. It includes the PSZ-9d suit, a closed cycle breathing system and an integrated system of anomalous field suppression. It provides quality bullet and splinter protection.
Duty Exoskeleton

A special version of the Exoskeleton used by Duty members. Through use of stronger materials it was possible to increase the protection against impacts, as well as to decrease the wear of the suit itself.
Freedom bodysuit
Standard stalker overalls, produced by Freedom workers. Contains a built-in container for artifacts.
Freedom science uniform

This body armor was created by Freedom craftsmen for scientific research in the Zone. A closed breathing cycle and special treated materials provide excellent protection against radiation and anomalies. However the built-in body armor doesn't even stand small firearms, so the suit is not suitable for active combat operations.
Freedom Exoskeleton
A special model of the Exoskeleton for members of Freed. Through the use of lighter materials it was possible to reduce the weight of the suit, as well as decrease the wear.
Storm body armor

Lightweight version of the exoskeleton, however without any hydraulic system. The bulletproof vest well protects against small firearms and the built-in gas mask and rubberized bodysuit provide good protection against anomalies. It is equipped with a built-in container for artifacts.
Scientific Monolith suit

Like most Monolith creations, its technology is unknown. The materials used aren't known as well, they are however lighter then their counterparts and provide very good protection against radiation. It also includes a closed-cycle breathing system.
Monolith suit

The bulletproof vest is capable of stopping small firearms. The outer shell consists of two layers and is able to protect the wearer from anomalies and radiation. It is equipped with a built-in container for artifacts.
Technology is unknown.
 
%c[255,255,255,255]Is used with: %c[default]Gas mask
Monolith body armor

The standard equipment for the Monolith assault troops. The body armor provides good protection against small firearms and the built-in gas mask and bodysuit made from unknown materials provide good protection against anomalies. It is equipped with a built-in container for artifacts.\nTechnology is unknown
Monolith Exoskeleton
Exoskeleton used by Monolith. Provides the wearer with good protection against all kinds of hazards. Wears out slowly.\nTechnology is unknown.
SSP-99M bodysuit

High-quality modification of the SSP-99 Ecologist bodysuit. It has been outfitted with added bullets and shrapnel protection at the torso. Designed to protect scientific expeditions. Provides effective protection against radiation and anomalies as well as hazardous chemicals. Despite only being designed for laboratory research it comes with five artifact containers and is equipped with a second-generation night vision device
M40 Gas mask
The M40 Gas mask reliably protects against poisonous gases, radioactive dust and biological weapons. Sees use among stalkers, but is mainly used by Mercenaries.
Sphere D helmet

Modification for the Sphere M12 helmet, modified by Duty technicians. The built-in gas mask provides increased protection against radiation and chemical hazards. Comes with a built-in night vision device.
Sunrise medic bodysuit

A modified Sunrise bodysuit. This DIY stalker bodysuit is a combination of a bodysuit of twin-layered rubberized cloth with Plexiglas lining and built-in body armor. Despite the fact that the body armor is incapable of protecting the wearer from even pistol bullets, the suit enjoys great popularity due to its low cost and modification potential. Comes with built-in artifact containers. Has a healing effect for the user.
